functions.name: delegate
functions.desc:
Ask a capable helper for help looking up a piece of information or performing an action.
Do not simply repeat what the user said as instructions.
You should use this to break up complex user queries into multiple simpler steps.
NOTE: Helpers cannot see previous parts of your conversation.

instructions.description: Detailed instructions on what your helper should do to help you.

functions.name: search
functions.desc: Search Wikipedia for an article with the given title, and get its content. If no such article is found, return similar article names.

msg.content: What is the GDP in USD of the four largest provinces in China by area?
What is the GDP in USD of the four largest provinces in China by area?

function.name: search
function.arguments: {"query": "List of Chinese administrative divisions by area"}

function.arguments: {"query": "List of Chinese administrative divisions by GDP"}

article_title: List of Chinese administrative divisions by area
List of Chinese administrative divisions by GDP

msg.content:
<document>
<title>List of Chinese administrative divisions by area</title>
<content>
For the administrative divisions governed by the Republic of China (Taiwan), see List of administrative divisions of Taiwan.



| Province-level divisionsof China by: |
| --- |
| * Area
* Population
* GDP
* GDP per capita
* Exports
* Infant mortality
* Sex ratio
* Disposable income
* HDI
* Highest point
* Growth rate
* Life expectancy
* Illiteracy rate
* Tax revenue
* Former capitals
 |
| * v
* t
* e
 |


This is a list of the first-level administrative divisions of the **People's Republic of China** (PRC), including all provinces (except the claimed Taiwan Province), autonomous regions, special administrative regions, and municipalities, in order of their total land area as reported by the national or provincial-level government. 





| Rank | Administrative division | Area (km²) | Area (sq mi) | Nationalshare (%) | Source
 |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | Xinjiang | 1,664,900
 | 642,800 | 17.31 | [1] |
| 2 | Tibet | 1,228,400
 | 474,300 | 12.77 | [2] |
| 3 | Inner Mongolia | 1,183,000
 | 457,000 | 12.30 | [3] |
| 4 | Qinghai | 722,300
 | 278,900 | 7.51 | [4] |
| 5 | Sichuan | 486,100
 | 187,700 | 5.05 | [5] |
| 6 | Heilongjiang | 454,800
 | 175,600 | 4.73 | [6][a] |
| 7 | Gansu | 425,800
 | 164,400 | 4.43 | [9] |
| 8 | Yunnan | 394,100
 | 152,200 | 4.10 | [10] |
| 9 | Guangxi | 237,600
 | 91,700 | 2.47 | [11] |
| 10 | Hunan | 211,800
 | 81,800 | 2.20 | [12] |
| 11 | Shaanxi | 205,800
 | 79,500 | 2.14 | [13] |
| 12 | Hebei | 188,800
 | 72,900 | 1.96 | [14] |
| 13 | Jilin | 187,400
 | 72,400 | 1.95 | [15] |
| 14 | Hubei | 185,900
 | 71,800 | 1.93 | [16] |
| 15 | Guangdong | 179,700
 | 69,400 | 1.87 | [17] |
| 16 | Guizhou | 176,200
 | 68,000 | 1.83 | [18] |
| 17 | Henan | 167,000
 | 64,500 | 1.74 | [19] |
| 18 | Jiangxi | 166,900
 | 64,400 | 1.74 | [20] |
| 19 | Shandong | 157,100
 | 60,700 | 1.63 | [21] |
| 20 | Shanxi | 156,700
 | 60,500 | 1.63 | [22] |
| 21 | Liaoning | 148,400
 | 57,300 | 1.54 | [23] |
| 22 | Anhui | 139,400
 | 53,800 | 1.45 | [24] |
| 23 | Fujian | 123,900
 | 47,800 | 1.29 | [25] |
| 24 | Jiangsu | 102,600
 | 39,600 | 1.07 | [26] |
| 25 | Zhejiang | 101,800
 | 39,300 | 1.06 | [27] |
| 26 | Chongqing | 82,400
 | 31,800 | 0.86 | [28] |
| 27 | Ningxia | 66,400
 | 25,600 | 0.69 | [29] |
| 28 | Hainan | 35,354
 | 13,650 | 0.37 | [30] |
| 29 | Beijing | 16,411
 | 6,336 | 0.17 | [31] |
| 30 | Tianjin | 11,917
 | 4,601 | 0.12 | [32] |
| 31 | Shanghai | 6,340.5
 | 2,448.1 | 0.066 | [33] |
| 32 | Hong Kong | 1,105.7
 | 426.9 | 0.011 | [34] |
| 33 | Macau | 30.5
 | 11.8 | 0.0003 | [35] |
| **—** | **People's Republic of China** | **9,616,400**[b] | **3,712,900**[c] | **100** |  |


## Notes[edit]


1. **^** Heilongjiang's officially reported area of 473,000 square kilometres (183,000 sq mi)[7] explicitly includes parts of Inner Mongolia's Oroqen Autonomous Banner administered as Songling District and Jiagedaqi District under Heilongjiang's Daxing'anling Prefecture. The combined area of these two districts is 18,200 square kilometres (7,000 sq mi),[8] which has been subtracted from Heilongjiang's reported area to arrive at the figure of 454,800 square kilometres (175,600 sq mi) reported in the table and corroborated by ref. 6.
2. **^** Figure is the sum of the areas of the listed administrative divisions, rounded to the nearest hundred square kilometres. The National Bureau of Statistics of China gives China's total land area as 9.6 million square kilometres.[36] The United Nations Statistics Division reports China's land area excluding Hong Kong and Macau as 9.5970 million square kilometres.[37]
3. **^** Figure is the sum of the areas of the listed administrative divisions, rounded to the nearest hundred square miles.

## References[edit]


1. **^** "新疆" [Xinjiang] (in Chinese). The Central People's Government of the People's Republic of China. 7 April 2013. Archived from the original on 2015-12-22. Retrieved 7 June 2016.
2. **^** "西藏概况(2007年)" [Overview of Tibet (2007)] (in Chinese). People's Government of Tibet Autonomous Region. 11 September 2008. Archived from the original on 2015-12-22. Retrieved 7 June 2016.
3. **^** "区域概况" [Overview of the region] (in Chinese). People's Government of Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region. 6 April 2016. Archived from the original on 2016-06-30. Retrieved 7 June 2016.
4. **^** "总体概况" [General overview] (in Chinese). People's Government of Qinghai Province. 12 April 2013. Archived from the original on 2016-04-25. Retrieved 7 June 2016.
5. **^** "2015年四川省农业农村经济基本情况" [State of agriculture and the rural economy in Sichuan Province, 2015] (in Chinese). Sichuan Province Rural Work Committee. 27 May 2016. Archived from the original on 2017-04-19. Retrieved 7 June 2016.
6. **^** "Heilongjiang – Survey". Ministry Of Commerce – People's Republic Of China. Archived from the original on 5 August 2013. Retrieved 25 July 2016.
7. **^** "黑龙江" [Heilongjiang] (in Chinese). The Central People's Government of the People's Republic of China. 12 April 2013. Archived from the original on 2016-06-24. Retrieved 25 July 2016.
8. **^** "兴安概况" [Overview of Daxing'anling] (in Chinese). Daxing'anling Prefecture. 12 April 2013. Archived from the original on 2016-03-14. Retrieved 25 July 2016.
9. **^** "甘肃" [Gansu] (in Chinese). The Central People's Government of the People's Republic of China. 16 April 2013. Retrieved 7 June 2016.
10. **^** *16-1: Land Characteristics*. Statistical Bureau of Yunnan Province. p. 474. ISBN 9787503769610. `{{cite book}}`: `|work=` ignored (help)
11. **^** "广西" [Guangxi] (in Chinese). The Central People's Government of the People's Republic of China. 16 April 2013. Archived from the original on 2016-04-28. Retrieved 7 June 2016.
12. **^** "湖南" [Hunan] (in Chinese). The Central People's Government of the People's Republic of China. 16 April 2013. Archived from the original on 2016-07-08. Retrieved 7 June 2016.
13. **^** "陕西" [Shaanxi] (in Chinese). The Central People's Government of the People's Republic of China. 7 April 2013. Archived from the original on 2016-04-27. Retrieved 7 June 2016.
14. **^** "河北概况" [Overview of Hebei] (in Chinese). People's Government of Hebei Province. Archived from the original on 2016-08-20. Retrieved 7 June 2016.
15. **^** "吉林" [Jilin] (in Chinese). The Central People's Government of the People's Republic of China. 20 March 2013. Archived from the original on 2016-04-28. Retrieved 7 June 2016.
16. **^** "湖北" [Hubei] (in Chinese). The Central People's Government of the People's Republic of China. 26 March 2013. Archived from the original on 2016-07-08. Retrieved 7 June 2016.
17. **^** "位置、范围和面积" [Location, extent and area] (in Chinese). People's Government of Guangdong Province. 21 January 2015. Archived from the original on 2016-08-15. Retrieved 7 June 2016.
18. **^** "贵州" [Guizhou] (in Chinese). The Central People's Government of the People's Republic of China. 10 August 2005. Archived from the original on 2016-09-19. Retrieved 7 June 2016.
19. **^** "1-3: Natural Resources". *Henan Statistical Yearbook 2015*. Statistical Bureau of Henan Province. Archived from the original on 2016-10-26. Retrieved 7 June 2016.
20. **^** "江西" [Jiangxi] (in Chinese). The Central People's Government of the People's Republic of China. 2 April 2013. Archived from the original on 2016-06-24. Retrieved 7 June 2016.
21. **^** "山东" [Shandong] (in Chinese). The Central People's Government of the People's Republic of China. 25 March 2013. Archived from the original on 2016-04-27. Retrieved 7 June 2016.
22. **^** "山西" [Shanxi] (in Chinese). The Central People's Government of the People's Republic of China. 17 April 2013. Archived from the original on 2016-04-28. Retrieved 7 June 2016.
23. **^** "1-3: 自然状况及资源" [Natural conditions and resources]. *Liaoning Statistical Yearbook 2014* (in Chinese). Statistical Bureau of Liaoning Province. Archived from the original on 2016-08-27. Retrieved 7 June 2016.
24. **^** "自然地理" [Physical geography] (in Chinese). People's Government of Anhui Province. Archived from the original on 6 June 2016. Retrieved 7 June 2016.
25. **^** "福建" [Fujian] (in Chinese). The Central People's Government of the People's Republic of China. 11 April 2013. Archived from the original on 2016-04-28. Retrieved 7 June 2016.
26. **^** "江苏" [Jiangsu] (in Chinese). The Central People's Government of the People's Republic of China. 28 March 2013. Archived from the original on 2016-07-08. Retrieved 7 June 2016.
27. **^** "浙江" [Zhejiang] (in Chinese). The Central People's Government of the People's Republic of China. 11 April 2013. Archived from the original on 2016-04-27. Retrieved 7 June 2016.
28. **^** "重庆" [Chongqing] (in Chinese). The Central People's Government of the People's Republic of China. 1 April 2013. Archived from the original on 2016-04-28. Retrieved 7 June 2016.
29. **^** "1-1: Administrative Divisions (2013)". *Ningxia Statistical Yearbook 2014*. Statistical Bureau of Ningxia Autonomous Region. Archived from the original on 2016-03-04. Retrieved 7 June 2016.
30. **^** "8-2: Land Resources". *Hainan Statistical Yearbook 2015*. Statistical Bureau of Hainan Province. Retrieved 7 June 2016.
31. **^** "北京" [Beijing] (in Chinese). The Central People's Government of the People's Republic of China. 25 March 2013. Archived from the original on 2016-04-28. Retrieved 7 June 2016.
32. **^** "天津" [Tianjin] (in Chinese). The Central People's Government of the People's Republic of China. 20 March 2013. Archived from the original on 2016-04-28. Retrieved 7 June 2016.
33. **^** "2.2: LAND AREA, POPULATION AND DENSITY OF POPULATION IN DISTRICTS AND COUNTIES (2014)". *Shanghai Statistical Yearbook 2015*. Shanghai Municipal Statistics Bureau. Archived from the original on 2016-09-20. Retrieved 7 June 2016.
34. **^** "Land area of Hong Kong". Census and Statistics Department, Hong Kong. 16 May 2016. Archived from the original on 2018-10-08. Retrieved 7 June 2016.
35. **^** "Land area". Cartography and Cadastre Bureau, Government of Macao SAR. Archived from the original on 2016-11-01. Retrieved 13 January 2017.
36. **^** "8-1: Land Characteristics". *China Statistical Yearbook 2014*. National Bureau of Statistics of China. Archived from the original on 2016-08-27. Retrieved 25 July 2016.

</content>
</document>

msg.name: search

msg.content:
The four largest provinces in China by area are:

1. **Xinjiang** - 1,664,900 km²
2. **Tibet** - 1,228,400 km²
3. **Inner Mongolia** - 1,183,000 km²
4. **Qinghai** - 722,300 km²

Their GDPs in USD for the year 2022 are:

1. **Xinjiang**: $263.77 billion
2. **Tibet**: $31.71 billion
3. **Inner Mongolia**: $344.31 billion
4. **Qinghai**: $53.67 billion

The four largest provinces in China by area are:

1. **Xinjiang** - 1,664,900 km²
2. **Tibet** - 1,228,400 km²
3. **Inner Mongolia** - 1,183,000 km²
4. **Qinghai** - 722,300 km²

Their GDPs in USD for the year 2022 are:

1. **Xinjiang**: $263.77 billion
2. **Tibet**: $31.71 billion
3. **Inner Mongolia**: $344.31 billion
4. **Qinghai**: $53.67 billion
